priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Contact Role for Clinical Study Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C127257

self.title: CDISC SDTM Contact Role for Clinical Study Terminology

definition: The terminology relevant to the role that the responsible individual or entity plays with respect to being a contact for the study.
name: Contact Role for Clinical Study
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Contact Role for Clinical Study Terminology

terms.definition: The person responsible for the competent authority application.
The contact person providing centralized, coordinated recruitment information for the entire study. (clinicaltrials.gov)
The secondary contact person providing centralized, coordinated recruitment information for the entire study. (clinicaltrials.gov)
The main or principal contact person for the clinical investigator network.
The study contact person who is responsible for questions from the public.
The study contact person who is responsible for questions from the scientific community.
The main or principal contact person at the facility.
The secondary contact person at the facility.
The contact person responsible for disseminating additional information about the study.
The person responsible for the independent ethics committee application.
An individual with expertise in the law who provides legal counsel and representation for a study.
The main or principal contact person for the study.

A person who has overall responsibility for the technical conduct of a study, as well as for the interpretation, analysis, documentation and reporting of results, and represents the single point of study control. (FDA)
The main or principal contact person for the subcontractor or subcontracting organization.

Any member of the clinical trial team designated and supervised by the investigator at a trial site to perform critical trial-related procedures and/or to make important trial-related decisions (e.g., associates, residents, research fellows). (ICH)
